subject: Design
title: Roman Villas: The Birth of the Floor Plan
description: Learn Roman Villas: The Birth of the Floor Plan in one minute.

hook.text: Roman villas had a central atrium, bedrooms off corridors, and dining rooms facing gardens. Sound familiar?

buildup.text: Romans invented the concept of rooms with specific purposes â€” a radical idea in the ancient world.

discovery.text: The triclinium (dining room) was designed so guests reclined on couches arranged in a U shape.

twist.text: Roman floor plans are strikingly similar to modern homes. The open-plan atrium is today's living room.

climax.text: Romans didn't just build houses. They invented the idea that different activities deserve different spaces.

punchline.text: Your home's floor plan was designed 2,000 years ago.

quiz.question: What did Roman villas pioneer in interior design?
